Technological advancements and ever-changing work policies provide people with an option to work from home, rather than the office where they meet the team face to face. List out and discuss the advantages and disadvantages of working from home?

                                                                    Title: Technology advancements in office and work culture

Technology advancement is the present developing work policy. According to the present senario the technology has be growing simultaneously and it has been a well advanced option in the current world.Here we are going to discuss the advantages and disadvantages of the changing policies provide people with an option to work from home, rather than the office where they met the team face to face.

According to me as the coin has two sides to it similarly there are both positive and negative for the advancement of technology. In my point of view work from home and face to face interactions both are usefull for the current world because, in some situations like meetings, solving problems, knowing some isssues etc we have to interact with the people definitely and in some particular need we can take help of our friends, and in some situations like emergency work we can do it from home it may save time from the traffic and also helps us to concentrate more on the work and it helps us to contribute our work presence in some functional time and emergency time at homes. This can be of two ways ie., every person will have their own views they can follow according to that and We can judge this by collecting some information from the people who are working in offices and can analyse the advantages and disadvantages of advance technology in offices. We can analyse this in some facts and figures by doing some analysis, by collecting data like primary and secondary data from the people this can be done by the following process like identifying the problems of the situation next analyse the problems next we have to collect the data and then analyse the data at last we have to conclude it by giving some conclusion or by giving some report. As discussed above we have both advantages and disadvantages for the technological advancements like,

Advantages:

1. We can save time in the traffic and journey.

2. More work can be done.

3. Can balance the life. 

4. Can work for some time when they are in leave, function or in journey.

5. No tension that they will reach in time or not so that they can concentrate on the work they are doing.

Disadvantages:

1. There may be deviations from the family members in the home.

2. People may feel lazy.

3. Proper information cannot be passed like face to face.

4.  If there are any doubts in the work it takes more time to clear it.

5. There will be disturbances in the atmosphere.

6. Negligence of work.

According to me the conclusion is we have to change ourself simultaneously with the technology it take us to the greater heights and makes our work easy and effectively. It completely depends on the work and situation. Changing and advancing the technology is pretty good and useful in some situations and it may effect our work culture in some situations so, following according to needs wants and situation is better and it can be analysed by doing some research. Technological advancements and ever changing work policies provide people with an option to work from home is preferable option for the offices and people.

In 2008 India owned its strongest domestic fundamentals has been remarkably branded from the global economic turmoil and named as the fastly growing econimies from the crices. But, now the growth of the Indian ecomony got impact. According to the cricies arround India in some of the developed economies, emergency of certain domestic issues took a part in the India`s growth monument.Everyone belive that India`s growth will gained by its strong macroeconomic fundamentals and the investment activity, building a policy environment favorably to India will act and also build the Indian economy durring the current decade.

Important issues of the case have been listed below-


India`s macro economis outlook 2002:

By FY20 India economy is expecting to grow more than US$ 5 trillion.

As of 2010 the size of Indian economy and Japanese economy will be almost similar

Till FY15 we expect that the same growth will be continued and economy moves into growth phase

In service sector India`s economy during the current decade is expected to grow high

Shares of investments to GDP will grow high till 40.7% of GDP during FY20 from 36.6% during FY10 which helps the Indian economy achieve a higher growth rate and also investment activity is growing high

During the current decade a cause and consequence of economic growth during the current decade of infrastructure 

The savings rate is expected to come down 39.5% during FY20 from 33.8% during FY10 and strong growth in domestic savings will have a strong support to the domestic investments

Share of discretionary spending is expected to rise significantly to 70% of private final consumption expenditure as compared to 60.0% in FY11

 

Economic growth drivers:

The key growth drivers will be the subtantial investments in social and physical infrastructure that will help the economy to reach higher growth over the current decade

By FY20 infrastructure investment in the electricity sector is expected to account for 3.8% of GDP  

Lead of employment generation is through the investment in the physical infrastructure

Infrastructure investment to 11.5% of GDP by FY20 from around 6.0% of GDP in FY12 is expected to grow from the increased production efficiency, reduction in cost of doing business and improved standard of living

To enhance total governement expentiture on healthcare the increased government focus towards improving overall healthcare facilities to 2.2% of GDP in FY20, as against 1.3% of GDP in FY12

Private sector share in infrastructure is estimated to grow from 39.4% in Fy12 to 48.0% in FY20

Agriculture investment sector to reach approximately 3.2% of GDP by FY20 as against 2.6% of GDP in FY12
